thread.title: Sunderland set for massive injury boost: Key player returns to training
thread.title_full: Sunderland set for massive injury boost: Key player returns to training

title: Sunderland set for massive injury boost: Key player returns to training
text:
GETTY Jordan Pickford has returned to first team training for Sunderland 
But Black Cats’ chief David Moyes may decide to delay the 22-year-old’s return due to Vito Mannone’s upturn in form. 
The Italian endured a nightmare start after replacing Pickford when his rival picked up a knee injury at Old Trafford on Boxing Day. 
But Mannone has kept successive clean sheets – only the Black Cats’ third and fourth of the season. 
GETTY Vito Mannone has enjoyed an up-turn in form recently 
GETTY David Moyes could choose to ease Pickford back into the starting XI 
And his improvement has bought Moyes precious time so he does not have to rush Pickford back for Saturday’s game against Southampton. 
A home win could take the Black Cats out of the relegation zone for the first time since August with last weekend’s stunning 4-0 thrashing of Crystal Palace taking them to within two points of safety. 
Moyes is still waiting to hear the extent of Jack Rodwell’s hamstring injury but John O’Shea and Adnan Januzaj, both subbed at Selhurst Park, should be available to face the Saints. Related articles
